title: Bully 2 was being made but got cancelled says Rockstar insiders
text:
It looks like Jimmy got cancelled

All those rumours about a sequel to Bully were apparently true, but while there was a playable demo work was stopped years ago.

For years now there’ve been rumours about a follow-up to 2006’s Bully, aka Canis Canem Edit. But rumours have been especially rampant after the release of Red Dead Redemption II, which contains several hidden references to the game.

Some people took this as evidence that an announcement for Bully 2 was imminent but, according to a source at website VGC, while a sequel was in development in the early 2010s enthusiasm at Rockstar ‘fizzled out’ and it was eventually canned.

Development was apparently centred at Rockstar New England, who worked on Bully: Scholarship Edition, and got as far as a playable demo with ‘basic open world gameplay’ but work stopped in late 2013.

Supposedly, Rockstar co-founder, and GTA and Red Dead Redemption writer, Dan Houser and his team had finished a script for the game as early as 2008, which included the initial scenes and an outline of the rest of the plot.

VGC corroborates earlier claims by YouTuber SWEGTA that the protagonist was Jimmy from the first game and that the story started at Jimmy’s stepdad’s house during the summer.

But apparently the problem was that nobody could decide what happened after that, or whether Jimmy went back to school or college – with Rockstar presumably worried the game would just end up as a rerun of the first one.

Given the time all this was going on the game used the same RAGE (Rockstar Advanced Game Engine) graphic engine as Grand Theft Auto IV and V, Max Payne 3, and Red Dead Redemption. Although no credible screenshots have ever leaked out.

None of this means that there won’t ever be a Bully 2 but the work that was being done appears to have finished. So if Rockstar do try again they’d almost certainly be doing so from scratch, which will mean an even longer wait till the sequel comes out.
